name: sagebrush
content:

a bush with silver-green leaves that grows especially in dry areas of western North America: On the canyon floor the sagebrush grew shoulder high. About 50 percent of the original sagebrush habitat was replaced by farms and communities.
More examplesFewer examplesThe deer are browsers that survive on shrubs and sagebrush during the winter.More than 150 million acres of sagebrush can be found throughout the West in areas of cold desert. The region is 504 square miles of rolling desert and sage brush.
